intro: Athrixia gerrardii, commonly known as the rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a small, mat-forming perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions. Athrixia gerrardii is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
